parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "FLEXPART",
  "details": {
    "environment": {
      "NETCDF": "/appl/opt/netcdf4/gcc-7.3.0/intelmpi-18.0.2/4.6.1/",
      "modules": ["gcc/7.3.0", "intelmpi/18.0.2", "hdf5-par/1.8.20", "netcdf4/4.6.1"],
      "WRFIO_NCD_LARGE_FILE_SUPPORT": "1"
    },
    "executable": "flexwrf33_gnu_serial",
    "input_data": "/homeappl/home/aliagadi/wrk/DONOTREMOVE/flexpart_management_data/runs/run_2019-10-02_13-42-52_/2018-02-14/flx_input",
    "runtime": "24 hours",
    "memory": "16GB per CPU",
    "nodes": "1",
    "queue": "serial",
    "output": "./output%j.txt",
    "error": "./error%j.txt",
    "mail": {
      "type": "END",
      "user": "diego.aliaga@helsinki.fi"
    }
  }
}
```

**Explanation of the script:**

The script is using SLURM (Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management) to run a FLEXPART simulation on a cluster. 

* **SLURM commands:**
    * `#SBATCH -e ./error%j.txt`: Sets the error output file.
    * `#SBATCH -o ./output%j.txt`: Sets the standard output file.
    * `#SBATCH -J flex`: Sets the job name.
    * `#SBATCH -n 1`: Requests one node for the job.
    * `#SBATCH -t 24:00:00`: Sets the walltime limit to 24 hours.
    * `#SBATCH -p serial`: Specifies the serial queue for the job.
    * `#SBATCH --mem-per-cpu=16000`: Requests 16GB of memory per CPU.
    * `#SBATCH --mail-type=END`: Sends an email when the job ends.
    * `#SBATCH --mail-user=diego.aliaga@helsinki.fi`: Sets the email address for notifications.

* **FLEXPART setup:**
    * The script sets up the environment by loading required modules and defining the path to the NetCDF library.
    * It defines the directory containing the FLEXPART executable and input data.
    * The script chooses the FLEXPART executable (`flexwrf33_gnu_serial`) and the input data directory.
    * Finally, it uses `srun` to execute the FLEXPART executable with the specified input data.

**The script is running a FLEXPART simulation using the serial version of the executable (`flexwrf33_gnu_serial`). It requires specific libraries like NetCDF, HDF5, and Intel MPI, and is configured to run on a single node with 16GB of memory per CPU. The job will run for 24 hours and will send an email notification to the specified address upon completion.**
